title.value: Step-GRAND: A Low Latency Universal Soft-input Decoder
title.justification: It is the exact title of the given paper.
title.quote: Step-GRAND: A Low Latency Universal Soft-input Decoder

extractions.description: The paper introduces Step-GRAND, a soft-input variant of the GRAND decoding algorithm, designed to achieve low average and worst-case decoding latency. It also presents a VLSI architecture for the Step-GRAND, demonstrating improvements over previous implementations in terms of area efficiency and throughput.

type.justification: The paper includes simulations and hardware implementations to demonstrate the performance benefits of Step-GRAND.
type.quote: The VLSI implementation results demonstrate that the proposed step-GRAND can decode CA-polar code (128, 105+11) with an average information throughput of 47.7 Gbps at the target FER of ≤ 10−7.

name.justification: The paper focuses on decoding algorithms which are a significant part of signal processing in communication systems.
name.quote: Index Terms—Guessing Random Additive Noise Decoding (GRAND), GRAND with ABandonment (GRANDAB), Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND (ORBGRAND), Maximum Likelihood (ML) decoding, Ultra-Reliable and Low Latency Communications (URLLC).

name.justification: The research includes a proposed VLSI architecture to achieve hardware acceleration for the Step-GRAND algorithm.
name.quote: The VLSI implementation results show that for a linear block code with length 128 (n) and 105 information bits (k), the proposed step-GRAND hardware can achieve an average information throughput of 47.7 Gbps.

name.justification: The research addresses decoding strategies for error correction codes like polar and BCH codes.
name.quote: Figures 2 and 3 provide a comparison of the decoding performance as well as the computational complexity, expressed as the number of codebook membership queries required, of step-GRAND with other GRAND variants for the respective 5G NR CRC-Aided (CA)-polar code (128, 105 + 11) and Bose-Chaudhuri-Hocquenghem (BCH) code (127, 106).

name.justification: It is the primary focus of the paper, proposed as an improvement over existing GRAND algorithms.
name.quote: In this work, we introduce step-GRAND, a soft-input variant of GRAND that not only offers a low average decoding latency but also reduces the worst-case decoding latency compared to soft-input ORBGRAND.

is_contributed.justification: Step-GRAND is a novel contribution proposed by the authors of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this work, we introduce step-GRAND, a soft-input variant of GRAND that not only offers a low average decoding latency but also reduces the worst-case decoding latency compared to soft-input ORBGRAND.

is_executed.justification: The proposed Step-GRAND is evaluated through hardware implementations.
is_executed.quote: The hardware implementation results demonstrate that the proposed step-GRAND can decode CA-polar code (128, 105+11) with an average information throughput of 47.7 Gbps at the target FER of ≤ 10−7.

is_compared.justification: Step-GRAND is compared with other variants of GRAND such as ORBGRAND in terms of throughput and latency.
is_compared.quote: At a target FER of ≤ 10−7 , the proposed step-GRAND (α = 2, β = 6, P = 6) achieves similar decoding performance to ORBGRAND (LWmax = 53, P = 6), but experiences a degradation in decoding performance of 0.3 dB when compared to ORBGRAND (LWmax = 64, P = 6).
